bio.one_liner: Former TRG commander from Fox River; principled, protective mentor whose duty and fairness anchor his leadership until the city’s destruction.
bio.summary: Jeb McTanner is a grizzled former Tactical Response Group commander from Fox River. An ISTJ, he is pragmatic, dependable, and emotionally restrained, guided by ethics and fairness. He protects subordinates—especially Chase—while navigating chain-of-command realities: he follows orders, voices objections when decisions seem unjust, and knows when to argue or obey. His communication is direct and respectful, with frustration channeled into terse words or controlled physicality. He reads people well under stress and uses that insight to nudge decisions without confrontation. Combat-trained with rifle, pistol, and hand-to-hand skills, he pairs field competence with leadership and clear command communication. The dossier notes coping via occasional whiskey. His narrative ends with the destruction of Fox River, which kills him and most of the TRG, leaving a mentoring legacy that shapes Chase’s guilt and growth.

appearance.hair: short-cropped faded brown with encroaching gray; tight goatee
appearance.style: Fox River TRG uniform: dark tactical jacket with subdued insignia, reinforced field pants, scuffed combat boots; holstered sidearm; precise, deliberate bearing

relationships.label: mentor/superior
relationships.notes: Acts as mentor and protector, showing fatherly concern and prioritizing Chase’s well-being.

relationships.label: superior
relationships.notes: Respects Francis’s authority but disagrees with decisions concerning Chase, creating tension.

relationships.label: long-standing-acquaintance/superior
relationships.notes: Knows her since youth; reads her cues and anticipates requests while respecting her authority.

relationships.label: superior
relationships.notes: Resents inconsistent and harmful directives regarding Chase.

arc.status_now: Deceased; killed when Fox River was destroyed, along with nearly all of the TRG.
arc.pre_pivot: Moral backbone of Fox River’s command, protecting subordinates and challenging unjust orders while maintaining discipline.
arc.post_pivot: Killed in the event; his memory and example continue to influence Chase.
arc.future_vector: Posthumous legacy projected to shape resistance and Chase’s moral development, as noted in the dossier.

items_and_tech.notes: Clipped with quiet precision as part of uniform.

items_and_tech.notes: Dark jacket with subdued TRG insignia, reinforced pants, and scuffed combat boots.

text_windows.bio_200w: Jeb McTanner is a former Tactical Response Group commander from Fox River whose principled, protective leadership defines his reputation. An ISTJ, he is pragmatic and dependable, voicing objections when orders seem unjust but ultimately executing his duty. He communicates directly and respectfully, channels frustration into controlled gestures, and reads people well under stress to nudge decisions without open confrontation. Trained with rifle, pistol, and hand-to-hand skills, he pairs field proficiency with calm command presence and clear communication. He cares deeply for subordinates—especially Chase—and prioritizes their well-being. His uniform is functional and worn with precise care, and the dossier notes occasional reliance on whiskey as a coping mechanism. McTanner’s story ends with Fox River’s destruction, which kills him and most of the TRG, leaving a legacy that shapes how survivors, particularly Chase, process guilt and resolve.
text_windows.arc_200w: Jeb McTanner is a disciplined field commander whose arc tracks the strain between duty and conscience. He begins as Fox River’s moral backbone, committed to protecting his unit and challenging unfair directives while respecting the chain of command. Political turbulence intensifies around Chase’s treatment, sharpening Jeb’s frustration yet not breaking his disciplined approach. A brief institutional shift—the dissolution of Jessop’s Order—might have signaled improvement, but the destruction of Fox River ends his efforts and life within days. The pivot annihilates his command and community, transforming him from active protector to posthumous influence. After his death, the dossier frames his legacy as a moral yardstick that will shape Chase’s growth and trauma processing and may echo in future resistance against those responsible for Fox River’s fall.
text_windows.skills_120w: Jeb McTanner is a combat-trained commander proficient with rifle, pistol, and hand-to-hand fighting. He excels at leadership, unit command, and clear, efficient communication. His tactical strengths include navigating chain-of-command dynamics, voicing principled objections while executing orders, and reading people under pressure to influence outcomes without confrontation. He maintains equipment meticulously and moves with deliberate economy. Documented limitations include internalized stress that risks burnout, a tendency to follow orders despite disagreement, overprotectiveness of Chase that can cloud judgment, and occasional reliance on whiskey as a coping mechanism.
text_windows.appearance_120w: Jeb McTanner is a stocky, weathered man in his early 50s, about 178 cm tall, with short-cropped faded brown hair threaded with gray and a tight goatee. His slate-gray eyes scan constantly; his face shows crow’s feet, a deep brow furrow, and rough, sun-worn skin. He wears Fox River TRG gear: dark tactical jacket with subdued insignia, reinforced field pants, scuffed combat boots, and a holstered sidearm. Movements are slow and deliberate, uniform precise, and a faint whiskey scent may linger after long nights.
text_windows.relationships_180w: Jeb McTanner centers relationships on duty and protection. With Chase, he is a mentor and protector, prioritizing the younger man’s safety and growth. With Master Scrivener Francis, he maintains respect for authority while disagreeing over decisions that affect Chase, producing a strained superior-subordinate dynamic. With Margdelain, a long-standing acquaintance since youth, he anticipates her requests and reads her cues while respecting her authority. Toward the Chancellor, he harbors resentment over inconsistent, harmful directives related to Chase. These ties show a pattern: loyalty to people under his care, willingness to challenge perceived injustice within the chain of command, and disciplined adherence to role even as frustration builds.

qa_pairs.q: What was Jeb McTanner’s role in Fox River?
qa_pairs.a: He was the former commander of the Tactical Response Group (TRG).

qa_pairs.q: How does McTanner relate to Chase?
qa_pairs.a: He acts as a protective mentor, showing fatherly concern and prioritizing Chase’s well-being.
The destruction of Fox River, which kills him and most of the TRG.

qa_pairs.q: Which strengths define his leadership style?
qa_pairs.a: Clear command communication, principled objections within the chain of command, people-reading under stress, and disciplined execution of orders.

qa_pairs.q: What are noted limitations in the dossier?
qa_pairs.a: Internalized stress, a tendency to follow orders despite disagreement, overprotectiveness of Chase, and occasional reliance on whiskey as a coping mechanism.

embedding_payloads.text: Jeb McTanner is a former Tactical Response Group commander from Fox River, an ISTJ leader who protects subordinates—especially Chase—while balancing objections to unjust orders with disciplined execution. He communicates directly, reads people under stress, and sustains field competence with rifle, pistol, and hand-to-hand skills. Occasional whiskey use appears as a coping mechanism; his death in Fox River’s destruction leaves a mentoring legacy.

Jeb McTanner is a principled field commander whose arc pits duty against conscience. He anchors Fox River’s command, challenges unfair directives, and seeks stability for his unit. A brief institutional shift offers hope, but the destruction of Fox River ends his life and command. His posthumous influence persists, shaping Chase’s trajectory and potential resistance to those responsible.

Jeb McTanner structures relationships around protection and professionalism: a protective mentor to Chase; a strained but respectful subordinate to Master Scrivener Francis; a long-standing acquaintance who respects Margdelain’s authority; and a resentful subordinate to the Chancellor due to harmful orders concerning Chase.

Jeb McTanner excels in leadership, unit command, and clear communication, with combat proficiency in rifle, pistol, and hand-to-hand. He navigates chain-of-command dynamics, voices principled objections, and nudges decisions without confrontation. Limitations include internalized stress, a tendency to follow orders despite disagreements, overprotectiveness of Chase, and occasional alcohol use. No cybernetics are noted.

Jeb McTanner is about 178 cm, stocky and weathered, with short-cropped faded brown hair threaded with gray, a tight goatee, and slate-gray eyes. His face shows crow’s feet, a deep brow furrow, and rough, sun-worn skin. He wears Fox River TRG gear with a holstered sidearm and moves with precise, deliberate control.
